creator: KitCrumpton@gd-decisionsystems.com
text:
This is on Windows 98. 

The "ant" command is simply unrecognizable. Results are 
BAD COMMAND OR FILE NAME

Yes, I did

   * follow the instructions on
    http://jakarta.apache.org/ant/manual/index.html 
    advising to use a short path name. See Below.
   * verify that JAVA_HOME is correct and ANT_HOME is correct

Is there a modification of this "for loop" in the ant script
that might help? I am referring, of course, to the 
comments on the ANT web site:

Windows 95 and Windows 98 Note:  
  On these systems, the script used to launch Ant will have problems if 
ANT_HOME is a long filename. This is due to limitations in the OS's handling of 
the "for" batch-file statement. It is recommended, therefore, that Ant be 
installed in a short path, such as C:\Ant. 

======> Thank you in advance!

creator: KitCrumpton@gd-decisionsystems.com
text:
Thank you for responding. I'm sorry I did not mention it before but I
did put ant\bin in the path.

I finally fixed the problem by modifying ant.bat. I modified the way
the classpath was being set. The code is shown below.

Thank you again.

:checkJava
set _JAVACMD=%JAVACMD%
set LOCALCLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%
rem for %%i in ("%ANT_HOME%\lib\*.jar") do call "%ANT_HOME%\bin\lcp.bat" "%%i"
call "%ANT_HOME%\bin\lcp.bat" "%ANT_HOME%\lib\ant.jar;%ANT_HOME%\lib\jaxp.jar;%
ANT_HOME%\lib\parser.jar"
